policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: Scenario-based long-term energy modelling and planning informs sustainable energy policy and strategy.

description.narrative: A modelling framework for energy system planning is implemented in Ukraine that is comparable to international best practice, and informed by current Danish approaches in terms of scope and technical detail. A Ukraine Energy Outlook and Technology Catalogues are integrated in policy development and decision making, and updated and published on regular (biennial) basis.

title.narrative: Scenario-based long-term energy modelling and planning informs sustainable energy policy and strategy.

description.narrative: A modelling framework for energy system planning is implemented in Ukraine that is comparable to international best practice, and informed by current Danish approaches in terms of scope and technical detail. A Ukraine Energy Outlook and Technology Catalogues are integrated in policy development and decision making, and updated and published on regular (biennial) basis.

title.narrative: Technology catalogue and technical guidelines for energy efficiency and fuel substitution in industry.

description.narrative: Companies have access and apply the developed technology catalogue and technical guidelines to determine and evaluate energy savings. Findings from technology catalogue, technical guidelines and fuel substitution are integrated into working procedures of the State Agency for Energy Efficiency and Energy Saving of Ukraine (SAEE) and other stakeholders.

title.narrative: Technology catalogue and technical guidelines for energy efficiency and fuel substitution in industry.

description.narrative: Companies have access and apply the developed technology catalogue and technical guidelines to determine and evaluate energy savings. Findings from technology catalogue, technical guidelines and fuel substitution are integrated into working procedures of the State Agency for Energy Efficiency and Energy Saving of Ukraine (SAEE) and other stakeholders.

title.narrative: Incentive schemes and technology guidelines support the uptake of energy efficiency improvements in industry, heat and power generation.

description.narrative: Enhanced and operational national support mechanism for energy efficiency in industry is adopted and further secondary legislation is formulated to support energy efficiency and highly efficient cogeneration, leading to increased investments in energy efficiency in industry.

title.narrative: Incentive schemes and technology guidelines support the uptake of energy efficiency improvements in industry, heat and power generation.

description.narrative: Enhanced and operational national support mechanism for energy efficiency in industry is adopted and further secondary legislation is formulated to support energy efficiency and highly efficient cogeneration, leading to increased investments in energy efficiency in industry.

title.narrative: Through the improvement of the national regulation, holistic planning capacity and framework conditions for investments, the modernization of district heating in Ukraine is supported.

description.narrative: Measures are being taken at institutional level by the Ministry for Communities and Territories Development (MinRegion) to improve the framework conditions for district heating systems in Ukraine leading to modernization of district heating (DH) systems in pilot projects. The DH regulation is further developed through the adoption of new guidelines, with inspiration from Danish experiences.

title.narrative: Through the improvement of the national regulation, holistic planning capacity and framework conditions for investments, the modernization of district heating in Ukraine is supported.

description.narrative: Measures are being taken at institutional level by the Ministry for Communities and Territories Development (MinRegion) to improve the framework conditions for district heating systems in Ukraine leading to modernization of district heating (DH) systems in pilot projects. The DH regulation is further developed through the adoption of new guidelines, with inspiration from Danish experiences.

title.narrative: Capacity developed in district heating planning and modernization at national level to realise the benefits of sector coupling and energy system efficiency.

description.narrative:
MinRegion has modernised the district heating regulation and guidelines with focus on sector coupling and energy system efficiency.
Stakeholders have become aware of the benefits of district heating for the energy system and the opportunities for sector coupling, through capacity development workshops and quantitative analyses.

title.narrative: Capacity developed in district heating planning and modernization at national level to realise the benefits of sector coupling and energy system efficiency.

description.narrative:
MinRegion has modernised the district heating regulation and guidelines with focus on sector coupling and energy system efficiency.
Stakeholders have become aware of the benefits of district heating for the energy system and the opportunities for sector coupling, through capacity development workshops and quantitative analyses.

title.narrative: Scenario-based long-term modelling of the Ukrainian energy system, presented in biennial Energy Outlook Reports to support national energy planning and policy development.

description.narrative:
Ukraine Energy Outlook is integrated in policy development and decision making, and reports progress with respect to energy and climate goals.
The Outlook includes a least-cost assessment for energy system development, and presents analysis of various policies and measures proposed and/or implemented by the MOE.
The Outlook is updated and published on a regular (biennial) basis, and MOE has sufficient capacity to conduct analyses without requiring support from DEA, or other international actors.
